source_sentence: 律苑事規卷第二
translation: Commentary on the Rules of the Court of Discipline, Volume II

source_sentence: 四明演忠律寺住持嗣祖比丘省悟編述地　落髮儀欲出家者律中作單白和僧使大眾知和合者善不爾者循房房語令知作已應與剃髮先請和尚次請阿闍梨應具儀至和尚所三拜互跪合掌請之侍者先念夫頭云。
translation: Siming Yanzhong Lüsi abbot Zizhu monk's enlightenment compilation and explanation of the ground haircutting ritual for those who want to leave home is described in the vinaya as a simple statement to the saṃgha to let the public know that it's a good match.

source_sentence: 夫以儒敦事父唯重於成身釋制依師務存於學道故使四儀軌範藉此以琢磨五分法身因茲而成立理須竭誠事奉故當克志陳詞恐汝未能我今教汝(請詞云)。
translation: "As a Confucian serving his father, the only emphasis is on becoming a body, and the explanation system relies on teachers to serve and train on the path, so the four mannerly standards are used to refine the five-part Dharma body, which is established here as a principle to be served with all sincerity.

source_sentence: 大德一心念我(某甲)今請大德為落髮和尚願大德為我落髮和尚我依大德故得剃髮出家慈愍故(三請)。
translation: "Sir, I am single-mindedly mindful of you, and I ask you to be a monk who has lost his hair. I wish you to be a monk who has lost his hair.

source_sentence: 和尚答云汝既陳請我當為汝作剃髮和尚(次引至闍梨所禮拜互跪侍者云)。
translation: The monk answered, "Since you've asked me to be a shaven-haired monk, I will be your shaven-haired monk." (He then led them to the ācārya's office, prostrating and kneeling with each other, and the attendant said.)

source_sentence: 夫厭處凡流忻參寶位將欲剪除於俗態理宜警策於蒙心矧在當仁必由名匠今為汝請(某人)為落髮阿闍梨而況此師誨人無倦接物有方故須專秉一心恭陳三請(詞云)。
translation: A monk who is disillusioned with the worldly world and is eager to join the jeweled ranks will want to cut off his mundane ways, and it's right to warn and stimulate his obscured mind.

source_sentence: 大德一心念我(某甲)今請大德為落髮阿闍梨願大德為我作落髮阿闍梨我依大德故得剃髮出家慈愍故(三請)。
translation: "Sir, I (someone) am single-mindedly mindful that I (someone) now ask you to be a hair-raising priest, and I wish you to be a hair-raising priest for me.

source_sentence: 闍梨答云汝既陳請我當為汝作落髮阿闍梨。
translation: The ācārya replied, "Since you've asked me to do this, I will be your haircutting priest.

source_sentence: 南山聖祖云應以諸部會明立出家儀式在於露地香水洒之周帀七尺四角懸幡中安一座擬出家者復設二勝座擬二師座欲出家者著本俗服拜辭父母尊者訖說偈云。
translation: Nanshan Shengzu said that the ritual for renunciation should be established by the assembly of the various schools by sprinkling the exposed ground with perfume, surrounding it with a seven-foot circumference and hanging banners with four horns, placing one seat in front of the proposed renunciant, and then setting up two seats in front of the proposed renunciant and two seats for the teacher. Those who want to renounce the world should wear their original secular clothes and bow to their parents.

source_sentence: 流轉三界中　　恩愛不能脫　　棄恩入無為　真實報恩者乃脫俗服(出清信士度人經)善見云以香湯洗浴除白衣氣仍著出家衣(今褊衫也)來至和尚前互跪應為說髮毛爪齒皮何此故有人曾觀此五今為落髮即發先業便得悟道如羅睺羅落髮未竟便得羅漢如熟癕待刺蓮華待日為說法已而向阿闍梨前坐(出善見論)以湯灌頂讚云。
translation: "In the midst of his transmigration through the three realms, he is unable to escape from kindness and love. He abandons kindness and enters into nonproductivity. Truly repaying kindness, he then takes off his secular clothes (from the Sutra of Clear Faithfulness). Good views say that he washes himself with incense and hot water, removes his white clothes and breath, and puts on his renunciant clothes (now called a small shirt).

source_sentence: 善哉大丈夫　　能了世無常　　捨俗趣泥洹　希有難思議敬禮十方佛已行者說偈云。
translation: "It's good, great man! He understands that the world is impermanent, that he's abandoned the conventional path to nirvāṇa, that it's difficult to fathom, that he honors the buddhas of the ten directions, that he's done it, and that he speaks a verse.

source_sentence: 歸依大世尊　　能度三有苦　　亦願諸眾生　普入無為樂阿闍梨乃為剃髮旁人為誦出家唄云。
translation: "Taking refuge in the Bhagavān, who can save the three realms from suffering and who wishes that all sentient beings will universally enter into the bliss of nonproductivity, the Ajātaśatru then shaved his hair and the others recited the words of the renunciant chant, 'Disfigure your form and keep your resolve.'

source_sentence: 毀形守志節　　割愛無所親　　棄家弘聖道　願度一切人(出度人經)與剃髮時當頂留三五周羅髮(周羅者小髮也五三者趣舉耳)來至和尚前互跪和尚問云。
translation: "When he shaves his hair, he'll leave three or five circumambulations on his head (circumambulation is a small hair, and five or three is a point of interest).

source_sentence: 今為汝去頂髮可否(答云)爾(或有作文白之方與其落髮　具如別帒)。
translation: "Would it be possible for me to remove your hair from your head?" (He replied, "Yes.") (There are cases where a monk creates a text to explain the direction in which his hair should fall, such as in a separate commentary.)

source_sentence: 準知落髮本是和尚恐其煩久故令闍梨為除餘者但留少許和尚親落今時先自剃作小髮非本教意除已和尚授與袈裟便頂戴受受已還與和尚如是三反和尚為著之(出善見論)說偈曰。
translation: He knew that the monk had originally shaved his hair because he was afraid it would bother him for a long time, so he asked the ācārya to remove the rest, leaving only a little bit for the monk to personally shave off. After removing it, the monk gave him the reddish-brown robe, put it on, accepted it, and returned it to the monk.

source_sentence: 大哉解脫服　　無相福田衣　　披奉如戒行　廣度諸眾生禮佛訖行遶三匝說自慶偈。
translation: "It's great that he wears the robe of liberation, the robe of the field of merit of signlessness, conforms to the precepts, and extends salutation to all sentient beings. After prostrating before the Buddha, he circumambulates him three times and speaks a verse of self-celebration.

source_sentence: 遇哉值佛者　　何人誰不喜　　福願與時會　我今獲法利禮大眾及二師已在下座受六親拜賀出家離欲心懷遠大父母等皆為禮作悅其道意也中前剃髮(出度人經)毗尼母云剃髮著袈裟已然後授三歸五戒。
translation: "It's wonderful to meet the Buddha. Who wouldn't be delighted with the timing of my blessings and vows? Now that I've received the benefits of the Dharma, I've paid homage to the great multitude and the two teachers, and I've been present at the lower seat to receive congratulations from six relatives, leave home, leave desire, become distant in mind, and have my parents and others pay homage to me and please my intention for the path.

source_sentence: 玄　受具戒策發儀
translation: Xuan Receiving the full set of precepts and the initiation ceremony

source_sentence: 初淨人打皷於法堂集沙彌兩人侍者到策發師安下處問訊一執手爐一鳴引磬策蒙師至法堂燒香陞座畢沙彌行道燒香迊眾沙彌同禮三拜侍者教沙彌坐鳴槌一下梵音師作梵訖大眾同聲誦傳香偈(如結界儀中)偈了椎一下侍者念請師夫頭云夫刻彫完眾相皆憑良匠之功教育成全材須假明師之力若不虔請安能允從今為汝等一心恭請某人為策發阿闍梨而況此師誨人無倦接物有方故須專秉一心恭陳三請。
translation: First, the pure man drummed in the Dharma hall and gathered two novices, the acolyte went to the Cemetery to ask questions, one held the brazier, one sounded the lead chime, and the Cemetery teacher went to the Dharma hall, burned incense, ascended to the seat, finished the novice's walk, burned incense, and the crowd of novices saluted together three times.

source_sentence: 鳴尺一下高聲唱戒子隨念云。
translation: He shoots out a ruler and sings aloud, saying, "The preceptor follows this thought.

source_sentence: 大德一心念我(某甲)今大德為策發阿闍梨願大德為我作策發阿闍梨我依大德故得受具足戒慈愍故(三請各尺一下侍者下座策發師答云)汝既陳請我當為汝作策發阿闍梨所有教示汝須諦听。
translation: "Sir, I (someone) is mindful of me with one mind, and now Sir, I wish Sir to be the initiating preceptor for me. I relied on Sir to receive the full set of precepts because of kindness." (The three invocations were each given with one ruler and one step, and the initiator replied, "Now that you've asked me, I will be the initiating preceptor for you, and I will instruct you to listen closely.")

source_sentence: 策發師說法(如要語中)說法竟(尺一下起立云)。
translation: After he had finished speaking (in the Essentials section), the curating teacher rose (with one foot in front of him) and said.

source_sentence: 上來恭依律範行策發法事所萃洪因端為祝延皇帝聖躬萬歲(云云)(如結界儀中)下座作處世界梵訖而散。
translation: He then respectfully followed the vinaya's example in performing the task of initiating the Dharma, and he blessed Emperor Yonan's noble body for all the years of his life (as in the Ritual for the Barrier).

source_sentence: 黃　受五戒儀
translation: Wong: Rituals for Receiving the Five Vinaya Precepts

source_sentence: 一作梵二請師三請聖四啟白五策導
translation: 1. to create a pantra, 2. to invite a teacher, 3. to invite a sage, 4. to reveal, and 5. to guide

source_sentence: 六遮難七懺罪八秉法九說相十發願
translation: six obstructions, seven sins to be confessed, eight teachings, nine characteristics to be explained, and ten vows to be made

source_sentence: ○第一作梵初淨人打皷於法堂集沙彌已兩人侍者到十師堂問訊一執手爐一鳴引磬迎五戒師前至法堂燒香登座沙彌行道燒香匝侍者鳴引眾沙彌同禮三拜侍者教沙彌坐鳴槌一下梵音師作梵訖大眾同聲念傳香偈云(如結界中)偈了槌一下侍者鳴尺一下念請師夫頭云。
translation: After the first Brahma ceremony, the first pure person drummed in the Dharma hall and gathered the novices, two attendants went to the ten preceptor's hall, one held a brazier, one sounded a bell to welcome the five preceptors, one burned incense in the Dharma hall, one ascended to the seat, one burned incense in the path, one sounded a bell to lead the novices to bow together three times, one taught the novices to sit, one sounded a hammer, one Brahma voice, and the whole assembly recited the incense transmission verse with one voice, saying (as in the boundary), "After the verse, one sounded a hammer, one sounded a foot, one recited the invocation to the head of the preceptor," and so forth.

source_sentence: ○第二請師夫元受三歸為翻往昔之邪境即授五戒先登初級之重樓不得明師難傳勝法今為汝等一心恭請(某甲)堂上(某人)和尚為五戒阿闍梨而況此師誨人無倦接物有方故須專秉一心恭陳三唱請(尺一下高唱云)。
translation: "The second inviter is the monk who first received the three refuges in order to reverse the mistaken state of the past, namely, to confer the five precepts, first ascended the first level of the heavy tower, and then failed to obtain a bright teacher who could hardly transmit the excellent teaching.

source_sentence: 大德一心念我(某甲)今請大德為五戒阿闍梨願大德為我作五戒阿闍梨我依大德故得受優婆塞戒慈愍故(三請各尺一下女受云優婆夷五戒師答云)汝既陳請我當為汝作五戒阿闍梨所有教示汝須諦听(侍者下座)。
translation: "Bhadrapāla, I'm single-mindedly mindful of myself (someone who is) now inviting Bhadrapāla to be a preceptor of the five precepts. May Bhadrapāla make me a preceptor of the five precepts, for the sake of compassionate acceptance of the lay practitioners because of Bhadrapāla.

source_sentence: ○第三請聖(戒師云)凡欲傳授戒法先須迎請常住三寶護法諸天降臨道場證明加被三寶威重不可坐邀須當起立隨我言詞至誠處請(尺一下齊聲和云)。
translation: ○Third, inviting the sages (the preceptor said): Whenever you want to confer the precepts, you must first welcome the abiding Three Treasures, the Dharma-guarding gods who descend upon the site of enlightenment to attest to the dignity of the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 我(某甲)稽首歸命一心恭請十方法界常住三寶清淨法身毗盧遮那佛圓滿報身盧舍那佛千百億化身釋迦牟尼佛當來下生彌勒尊佛極樂世界無量壽佛十方三世一切諸佛大小兩乘毗尼戒藏一切法寶文殊師利菩薩普賢菩薩觀世音菩薩大勢至菩薩十方三世諸大菩薩南山聖師菩薩大智律師菩薩西天此土傳法祖師聲聞緣覺得道真僧惟願三寶聞今奉請同降道場證明受戒(尺一下念)。
translation: 我(某甲)稽首歸命一心恭請十方法界常住三寶清淨法身毗盧遮那佛圓滿報身盧舍那佛千百億化身釋迦牟尼佛當來下生彌勒尊佛極樂世界無量壽佛十方三世一切諸佛大小兩乘毗尼戒藏一切法寶文殊師利菩薩普賢菩薩觀世音菩薩大勢至菩薩十方三世諸大菩薩南山聖師菩薩大智律師菩薩西天此土傳法祖師聲聞緣覺得道真僧惟願三寶聞今奉請同降道場證明受戒(尺一下念)。

source_sentence: 南無十方常住佛(法僧同各三聲各尺一下)我(某甲)一心虔請護持正教列席諸天三界萬靈十方聖眾今年歲分賞罰神祇大元土境諸舊善神府城香火州縣聦明現前眾等本命星天此一住處護伽藍神惟願聞今奉請光降道場證明受戒(尺一下)。
translation: With one heart, I (someone A) respectfully request that the buddhas and gods of the three realms, the myriad souls of the ten directions, and the holy ones of this year's age, reward and punishment deities, and the great original land realm, the old good deities, the fragrant gods of the capital city, the states and prefects, the kuangming gods, and the manifestly living star gods, may I hear that I am hereby invited to descend into the site of the path to receive the precepts (one foot in length).

source_sentence: 南無護法諸天菩薩(三聲各尺一下畢坐)○第四啟白上來恭請三寶必賜降臨願展祥光俯垂鑒念現前一眾今欲進受五戒為出家入道之基本切慮人根淺薄魔障忽生故先歸命佛天願求加被庶使現前一眾正當傳授之時一心不亂萬境條然能所相冥授受無昧仰冀威靈決彰感應(念)。
translation: The fourth one inspires the ascended masters to respectfully ask the Three Treasures to grant their descent, vowing to shed an auspicious light and look down in recognition of the fact that the present congregation now wishes to undertake the five precepts as the fundamental steps toward leaving home and entering the path, and is concerned about the shallowness of human faculties and the sudden emergence of magical hindrances.

source_sentence: 南無十方常住佛(法僧各三聲)
translation: Homage to the ten eternally abiding buddhas (three tones each for Dharma and Saṃgha)

source_sentence: 南無護法諸天菩薩(三聲各尺一下畢坐)○第五策導戒師說緣境發心(如要語中)。
translation: "Homage to the bodhisattvas of the gods who protect the Dharma (three times each, one foot down, one seat up).

source_sentence: ○第六遮難上來為汝說緣境發心已更須身器清淨若有遮難障戒不發我今問汝汝當實答先問重難。
translation: After the sixth obstruction comes up to explain for you the mind aroused from perceptual objects, you must also purify your physical apparatus. If there are any obstacles to the issuance of the precepts, I'll now ask you to answer them truly.

source_sentence: 一邊罪二污尼三賊住四外道五黃門
translation: 1. extreme crimes, 2. defiling the nun, 3. abiding in thieves, 4. non-Buddhists, and 5. the yellow door.

source_sentence: 六殺父七殺母八殺阿羅漢九破僧
translation: six killing of fathers, seven killing of mothers, eight killing of arhats, and nine refuting the saṃgha

source_sentence: 十佛血十一非人十二龍畜十三二形
translation: ten buddha-bloods, eleven non-humans, twelve nāga-animals, and thirteen dual forms

source_sentence: 更問輕遮(不問年歲衣鉢止十三遮耳)。
translation: He also asked about the lesser refutation (not asking about years and years of clothing and bowls, but only the thirteenth refutation).

source_sentence: 問云　汝今名誰　五戒和尚名誰　父母听許　不負人債　非下使人　名祿官人　汝是丈夫　丈夫五病。
translation: He asked, "Who are you now called? Who are the names of the five precepts monks? Who are your parents' approval? You're not in debt to anyone, you're not a servant, you're a man of honor, you're a husband, and you have the five illnesses of a husband.

source_sentence: ○第七懺罪上來問汝遮難既無更須罪根清淨方堪傳受隨我言詞行懺悔法。
translation: Since the seventh repentance is for sins, I've come up to ask you to refute them, but since there are no more sins, I must clear my roots before I can transmit the repentance teaching according to my words.

source_sentence: 我(某甲)至心懺悔往昔所造諸惡業(云云如別帋三說各尺一下)。
translation: I (someone) wholeheartedly repent of the bad actions I've done in the past (as described in three separate commentaries, each measuring one foot).

source_sentence: ○第八秉法罪根既淨戒體可發欲發此體必假三歸是故歸依理體三寶幸勿異緣(尺一下戒子一拜隨聲念云)我(某甲)歸依佛(法僧以下並如羯磨經中三授各尺一下)。
translation: Since the eighth rank of the Dharma-supporting sinful root is purified, the essence of the precepts can be developed, and in order to develop this essence, it's necessary to take refuge in the three treasures.

source_sentence: 又三結(尺一下云)我(某甲)歸依佛竟(法僧三結各尺一下)。
translation: He also tied the three knots (one foot in front of each other), saying, "I (Soma) take refuge in the Buddha!" (The Dharma and Saṃgha community tied the three knots one foot in front of each other).

source_sentence: ○第九說相善男子既已納戒今當示汝戒相受已依相奉持善男子盡形壽不殺生(云云)不盜　不邪婬　不妄語　不飲酒。
translation: Good sons, once you've accepted the precepts, you'll now be shown the precepts and observe them in accordance with their characteristics. Good sons will live out their lives without killing (clouds), not stealing, not committing sexual misconduct, not speaking falsely, and not drinking alcohol.

source_sentence: ○第十發願行相既明大願主汝當至誠同聲發願我(某甲)至心發願(云云)(如要語中)(尺一下)。
translation: Having explained the tenth vow and its accompanying form, you, the master of the great vow, should sincerely vow with one voice that I (someone A) will wholeheartedly vow (clouds) (as in the essential phrases) (one foot).

source_sentence: 回向云(如結界剏結中)至波羅蜜(下坐)梵音師作處世界梵訖而散。
translation: He returns the vow (as in the bondage of the cancer) to the perfection (lower seat), where the Brahma-sound master creates the world, and Brahmā replies and scatters.

source_sentence: 宇　受十戒儀
translation: U. Rituals for Receiving the Ten Precepts

source_sentence: 一作梵二請師三請聖四啟白五策導
translation: 1. to create a pantra, 2. to invite a teacher, 3. to invite a sage, 4. to reveal, and 5. to guide

source_sentence: 六遮難七秉法八說相九德數十迴向
translation: six obstructions, seven rules, eight explanations of characteristics, nine virtues, and ten dedications of merit

source_sentence: ○第一作梵初淨人打皷集沙彌已兩人侍者到十師堂問訊一執手爐一鳴引磬十戒和尚闍梨二師前至法堂齊燒香闍梨登高座和尚於座下坐已沙彌行道燒香迊侍者鳴引眾沙彌同禮三拜侍者教沙彌坐鳴槌一下梵音師作梵訖大眾同聲誦傳香偈(如結界中)　(偈了又推一下)。
translation: After the first Brahmā teacher and the first pure person had drummed and gathered the novices, two attendants went to the hall of the ten preceptors to inquire about the ten precepts, one held a brazier, one sounded the lead chime, and the two masters went to the Dharma hall and burned incense together.

source_sentence: ○第二諸師侍者二人上首鳴尺一下念誦總夫頭云。
translation: ○Secondly, the two attendants of the śrāmaṇeras went up and sounded the ruler once to recite the verse of the chief monk.

translation: "When gold is refined and cast into a thing, the image is produced, the original cause is set forth, and the person's conduct, having done so, and having paid homage to them, are all teachers of dignity.

source_sentence: 大德一心念我(某甲)今請大德為十戒和尚願大德為我作十戒和尚我依大德故得受沙彌戒慈愍故(三請各尺一下)。
translation: "Venerable sir, I am mindful with one mind that (someone A) now invites Venerable Sir to be a monk of the ten precepts, and I wish Venerable Sir to be a monk of the ten precepts for me.

source_sentence: 和尚答云汝既陳請我當為汝作十戒和尚(下首侍者尺一下云)。
translation: The monk replied, "Since you've asked me to be a monk of the ten precepts, I will be a monk of the ten precepts for you." (The junior attendant gave one ruler to the other).

source_sentence: 大德一心念我(某甲)今請大德為十戒阿闍梨願大德為我作十戒阿闍梨我依大德故得受沙彌戒慈愍故(三請各尺一下)。
translation: "Venerable sir, I (someone) am single-mindedly mindful that I (someone A) now ask Venerable Sir to be the preceptor of the ten precepts. May Venerable Sir be the preceptor of the ten precepts for me, for the sake of kindness and compassion (one ruler for each of the three requests).

source_sentence: 闍梨答云汝既陳請我當為汝作十戒阿闍梨所有教示汝須諦听(侍者下座)。
translation: The ācārya replied, "Since you've asked me to make you a preceptor for the ten precepts, I will instruct you to listen closely." (The attendant descended from his seat.)

source_sentence: ○第三請聖(闍梨云)凡欲傳授戒法先須迎請常住三寶護法諸天臨降道場證明加被三寶威重不可坐邀須當起立隨我言詞至誠虔請(尺一下沙彌齊聲和云)。
translation: The third invitation to the sages (the preceptor said, "Whenever you want to confer the precepts, you must first welcome the eternally abiding Three Treasures, the Dharma-guarding gods who descend on the site of enlightenment to attest to the dignity of the Three Treasures.

source_sentence: 我(某甲)稽首歸命一心虔請十方法界常住三寶(請詞如五戒中)。

source_sentence: ○第四啟白上來恭請三寶必賜降臨願展祥光俯垂鑒念現前一眾今欲進受沙彌十戒為出家入道之基本切慮人根淺薄魔障忽生故先歸命佛天願求加被庶使現前一眾正當傳授之時一心不亂萬境條然能所相冥授受無味仰冀威靈決彰威應(念)。
translation: ○Fourth, I ask the ascendants to respectfully invite the Three Treasures to surely grant their descent, wishing for the auspicious light to look down and consider the present congregation's desire to further receive the śrāmaṇer ten precepts as the fundamental basis for leaving home and entering the path, and concerned that human faculties are shallow and demonic hindrances suddenly arise.

source_sentence: 南無十方常住佛(法僧)護法諸天菩薩(各三聲尺一下坐)○第五策導云云(如要語中)。
translation: "Namu, the ten eternally abiding buddhas (Dharmas and saṃgha) of the ten directions, the gods and bodhisattvas who protect the Dharma (three times each, one foot down, one seat), and the fifth guidance (as in the essential discourse).

translation: The sixth question is, "Obstacles to the precepts require a pure body and implements before you can receive them, lest you carry obstructions to the precepts.

source_sentence: 當隨我言歸依三寶(尺一下一拜隨聲念云)。

translation: 1. don't kill, 2. don't steal, 3. don't commit sexual misconduct, and 4. don't speak falsely.

source_sentence: 五不飲酒六不著香油塗身七不歌舞作倡伎樂八不得坐高廣大床九不得非時食十不得捉生像金銀錢寶此是沙彌十戒盡形壽不得犯何故止列十戒者為喜犯故然此十戒無作之體是為無漏解脫功德汝當護持無得毀犯。
translation: Five mustn't drink alcohol, six mustn't rub themselves with scented oil, seven mustn't sing or dance, create music, eight mustn't sit on a high, wide bed, nine mustn't eat at inappropriate times, and ten mustn't catch images of beings in gold, silver, money, or treasure.

source_sentence: ○第九五德十數(如要語中)。
translation: ○The ninth of the five virtues and ten numbers (as described in the Essentials).

source_sentence: 五德者一發心出家懷佩道故二毀其形好應法服故三委棄身命遵崇道故四永割親愛無適莫故五志大乘為度人故此之五德出家大要也。
translation: The five virtues are, first, motivating people to leave home with the intention of admiring the way, second, disfiguring their physical appearance and agreeing to the Dharma robe, third, abandoning their bodies and lives to follow the noble path, fourth, permanently cutting off affection and having no trouble, and fifth, aspiring to the great vehicle in order to save others.

source_sentence: 十數者一者一切眾生皆依仰食二者名色三者痛痒想四者四諦五者五陰六者六入七者七覺支八者八正道九者九眾生故十者十一切入已上十數一一對破外道要令汝等專心思擇辨別邪正故也(此之十數各有名義廣在律文茲不繁引　尺一下起立)。
translation: The ten numbers are: 1. All sentient beings rely on food that they admire; 2. name-and-form; 3. perceptions of pain and itch; 4. the four truths; 5. the five aggregates; 6. the six sense-fields; 7. the seven factors of awakening; 8. the eightfold correct path; 9. the nine factors of sentient beings; 10. the eleven factors that are cut off from the above ten numbers one by one to refute non-Buddhists and cause you to concentrate your minds on discerning what's right and wrong.

source_sentence: ○第十回向上來恭依律範行十戒法事所萃洪因端為祝延　聖壽萬安(迴向等文如結界中)。
translation: ○Tenth time, he came up to respectfully follow the vinaya's example and practice the ten precepts, which are extracted from the causes and blessed to prolong the life of the sage (the text of the dedication of merit follows the section on boundaries).

source_sentence: 下座維那作處世界梵訖而散是夜請壇師擘引標如上壇儀之中明之。

translation: First, on the first night after receiving the ten precepts, the ten masters and their preparatory staff assembled, and then the ten masters would gather the novices by sounding the drums when the pure people arrived in the hall, one holding a brazier, one sounding a bell, and one carrying a lamp to welcome the masters to the Dharma hall, one sitting in line under the seat, one saluting the novices on the path, three prostrations to each other after burning incense, and then the attendant broke the novices' banners and the ten masters' taps and two lower recitations, saying.

translation: "Sir, I (someone) am single-mindedly mindful of you, and now I ask you to be a monk who has attained the precepts. May you be a monk who has attained the precepts for me.

source_sentence: 善男子汝袱中所有三衣一鉢名體色量乃恒沙諸佛之標幟賢聖沙門之軌儀比丘受戒之正緣為僧終身之道具祖師道若不已有定不得戒此衣此鉢是汝三人已有不(答云)已有衣鉢雖是已有要須身器清淨方堪進受若有遮難定不得戒我今問汝汝須實答(遮難釋相如羯磨經疏中)。
translation: "Good sons, the three garments and one bowl you have in your possession are called the substantial amount, which are the standard of the buddhas of the Tathāgata, the proper condition for a noble ascetic to receive the precepts, the right condition for a monk to receive the precepts, and the props for a monk's life on the patriarchal path.

source_sentence: 問邊罪　污尼　賊住　外道　黃門　殺父母　殺阿羅漢　破僧　出佛血　非人　龍畜　二形更問輕遮　汝各　和尚名　年滿　衣鉢　父母負人債　下使人　官人　丈夫　五病汝三人既前無重難後無輕遮可納戒法(大略如此餘如要語中)少刻壇上亦當如是答之汝等今於壇下立我往僧中作法和尚問眾僧眾僧默可我舉手召汝汝可即來。
translation: You three, since there are no serious objections in the first place, and no minor objections in the second place, may accept the precepts (roughly speaking).

source_sentence: 其教授師令戒子起立為正著七條著履揲具衣鉢袱置手中語今於壇下立我當召汝教授師即從座起入壇南面東堦上第二級面西行回身從西堦上至壇上朝東向僧舒手相及處敷具正立合掌白云。
translation: The preceptor told the monk to stand up and correctly put on the seven stripes, put on his shoes, and put his robe and bowl in his hand.

source_sentence: 召沙彌入眾單白羯磨。
translation: He summoned the novice monk to enter the congregation and simply stated the karma.

source_sentence: 大德僧听(云云)(如上)教授師只一拜収具問訊仍前西入復位坐之　其第二引和尚(即上第一引羯磨師也)拈標差僧云。
translation: The second monk (the first monk who had led the karma-master above) took his cue and told the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 彼第二引(沙彌某甲某甲某甲)將陞寶壇從僧乞戒受具戒今請某寺闍棃為羯磨師(只第一引教授師也)某寺闍棃為教授師(只第一引答法師也)某寺闍梨答所成法(只第一引第五師也下皆例此周而〔始〕)。
translation: "The second monk (Śrāmaṇer Ājñāta-kauṇḍinya) will ascend to the jeweled altar, beg for precepts from the saṃgha, and receive the full set of precepts. He now asks the monastery preceptor to be the karmācāra master (the first-ranked professor only), the monastery preceptor to be the professor (the first-ranked Dharma teacher only), and the monastery preceptor to be the Dharma teacher (the fifth-ranked teacher only).

source_sentence: 第二引羯磨師差教授師單白詞語前後問答並同前　其第二引教授師如前出眾從壇上東階而下侍者引去教授師　其第一引教授師亦從座起於佛後出壇西階上立舉手喚前已教授沙彌云(某甲某甲某甲)來戒子上壇佛前一行立為接衣鉢袱次第安佛前小几案上為戒子燒香并四聖處香了令問訊禮三拜却引戒子從右邊北入遶佛後轉至和尚前為所衣鉢袱安羯磨師前小机案上令敷具禮三拜已皆互跪合掌告云。
translation: The second-introduced professor then sends out the professor, simply explains the words, asks and answers the questions before and after, and does the same as before. The second-introduced professor then leaves the congregation as before, goes down the east stairs from the altar, and the attendant leads the professor away. The first-introduced professor also rises from his seat, goes out from behind the Buddha onto the west stairs of the altar, raises his hand, and calls out to the previously taught monk, saying, "So-and-so, so-and-so, so-and-so, so-and-so, come on up to the altar, stand in line in front of the Buddha, take the robe and bowl bag, place it sequentially on a small table in front of the Buddha, burn incense for the preceptor, and scent the four holy places.

source_sentence: 汝當懇惻至誠仰憑清眾求哀乞戒恐汝未能我今教汝。
translation: "You must sincerely and sincerely rely on the pure multitude to beg for the precepts, for fear that you might not be able to follow my lead.

source_sentence: 大德僧听我(某甲)從和尚(某甲)求受具足戒我(某甲)今從僧乞受具足戒(某甲)為和尚願僧慈愍故拔濟我(三乞了)令戒子復座教授師歸位坐定次羯磨師對眾問難即白云。
translation: Venerable monk, listen to me (certain person) as I (certain person) seek to receive the full precepts from the monk (certain person). I (certain person) now beg to receive the full precepts from the saṃgha (certain person) for the monk's sake.

source_sentence: 對眾問難單白羯磨。
translation: "He simply explains the difficulty to the crowd, saying, 'Karma.'

source_sentence: 大德僧听(如羯磨經中)問成否了(羯磨師說衣鉢名義遮難等文如要語中若受戒人多不宜廣說)羯磨師作單白已再問衣鉢有無及十三重難十六輕遮並同前教授師出眾問之一般然後說緣境發心(備如要語中)說了。
translation: After the ritual master explains the existence or nonexistence of the robe and the thirteen serious difficulties and sixteen minor objections, he asks the same general question as the previous ritual master, then he explains the circumstances and arouses the intention (as explained in the Essentials) to explain it.

source_sentence: 秉受具足戒白四羯磨(如羯磨經中)三番無差得戒圓滿　作法既了令戒子三人朝外座待第二引教授師上壇作白召羯磨了又待教授師入眾生訖听第三引羯磨師差教授師了方令戒子起三拜侍者在壇下鳴引引下壇往望壇處燒香問訊仍引至祖師堂燒香三拜了引入護壇侍者付小六念與之。
translation: After he had received the full set of precepts and made the four white karmas (as in the karmic scriptures), he allowed the three preceptors to sit facing outward until the second master was summoned to the altar and made the four white karmas, and then waited until the master had entered the congregation to hear the third master's announcement before allowing the preceptors to rise and make three prostrations to the altar attendant, who would sound the invocation and lead them off the altar to the viewing platform to burn incense and exchange greetings. After he had led them to the patriarch's hall and burned incense and made three prostrations, he introduced the altar guard attendant and gave him the six lesser recitations.

source_sentence: 次說隨相及授四依法。
translation: Next, he explains the four laws that follow the Buddha's appearance and are conferred.

source_sentence: 先說四波羅夷法　次說四依法(其文備如羯磨經中)。
translation: First, he explains the four grave offenses and then he explains the four laws (the text of which is summarized in the Karma Sutra).

source_sentence: 次請師作衣藥鉢展轉淨主。
translation: Next, he invites the master to make his robe, medicine, and bowl, and then he extends the pure master.

source_sentence: 是夜淨人打皷集新僧於壇上侍者至說淨師所問訊鳴引引說淨師至壇上坐訖參頭燒香畢眾禮三拜令坐侍者鳴引一下念請師夫頭云。
translation: On that night, the purifier drums, gathers the new monks at the altar, asks an attendant to the preceptor, greets him, and summons him to sit on the altar. After he bids incense, the assembly bids three prostrations, asks the attendant to sit, and then summons the preceptor to call out to him, saying.

source_sentence: 夫因畜長財致使袈裟而離體能行說淨免教鐵葉以纏身不得明師安知深旨今為汝等一心恭請(某人)為衣藥鉢展轉淨施主而況此師誨人無倦接物有方故須專秉一心恭陳三請(引一下眾請云)。
translation: "When the monk's wealth is accumulated, the monk's robe is removed from his body, and he's able to practice preaching purity without teaching iron leaves that bind his body.

source_sentence: 大德一心念我(某甲)今請大德為衣藥鉢展轉淨施主願大德為我作衣藥鉢展轉淨施主慈愍故(三請各引一下淨主答曰)汝既陳請我當為汝作衣藥鉢展轉淨施主所有教示汝須諦听。
translation: "Sir, I (someone A) now ask you to be the pure donor of clothing, medicine, and bowls for me. May you be the pure donor of clothing, medicine, bowls, and extensions for me, so that you may kindly listen (citing one of the three requests).

source_sentence: 淨施主說法(如要語中)說淨師說法了侍者一人先去請誦經師鳴引從壇東堦而上說淨師從西堦而下誦經師就座趺坐訖戒子參頭炷香一片同眾三拜皆坐次誦經師誦遺教經訖下壇而去眾戒子繞壇念楞嚴呪參頭回向此乃一壇受事辨若來日又受戒更如前行。
translation: When the Venerable of the Pure Land preaches (as in the Essentials section), one of the attendants first goes and asks the sūtra reciter to sound the call to come up from the east gate of the altar and tell the Venerable of the Pure Land to come down from the west gate and recite the sūtras. The master takes his seat and sits down, and the preceptor joins in burning incense and making three prostrations with the crowd.

source_sentence: 律苑事規卷第二
translation: Commentary on the Rules of Procedure for the Vinaya, Volume 2
